title: Developing a growth model + marketplace growth strategy | Dan Hockenmaier
key_insights: 50% of a growth model's value comes from building it - forces understanding of how business works
Retention is typically more impactful than acquisition but harder to move - focus on early user experience
Marketplaces require 'gardener' approach with light touch vs 'construction worker' approach of SaaS
Demand aggregation is ultimately what matters most - supply follows strong demand
Liquidity (reliability of marketplace) is the critical metric before anything else matters
Share of wallet indicates depth over breadth and creates defensibility through reduced multi-tenanting
Unbundling opportunities are rarer than thought - scale benefits usually outweigh UX improvements
Newer marketplaces charge higher commissions by doing more work in the value chain

guest_background.current_role: Head of Strategy and Analytics at Faire

topics_discussed: Building growth models for different business types
Marketplace health metrics (GMV, unit economics, liquidity, share of wallet)
Market fragmentation importance for B2B marketplaces
Future evolution of marketplaces toward higher commissions
When marketplaces evolve beyond marketplace model
Liquidity metrics and customer experience optimization
Retention improvement through early user experience
Marketplace pricing complexity and second-order effects
memorable_quotes: If you think about running a marketplace, you're basically a gardener. You have to have a very light touch.
Demand is the currency. If you are successful at aggregating the demand in your industry, you will have the winning marketplace.
The more painful the process of building [a growth model] is, probably the more you're learning.
frameworks_mentioned: Growth model building blocks (acquisition, retention, monetization)
Marketplace evolution stages (1.0 aggregation, managed, heavily managed)
summary: Dan Hockenmaier shares deep expertise on building growth models and scaling marketplaces, covering everything from core metrics and expansion strategies to the nuanced dynamics of supply-demand optimization. The conversation provides actionable frameworks for marketplace operators while exploring the strategic evolution of the marketplace business model.
